pullRequest.body:
- Add lemmas about `ùìù[<] a` and `ùìù[‚â§] a` in a `PredOrder`.
- Add lemmas about `ùìù[>] a` and `ùìù[‚â•] a` in a `SuccOrder`.
- Add `CovBy.nhdsWithin_Ici` and `CovBy.nhdsWithin_Iic`.
- Prove that an `OrderClosedTopology` on a linear order which is a `PredOrder` and a `SuccOrder` is discrete.
- Cleanup theorems about `OrderTopology` vs `DiscreteTopology`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [b4d0e77165](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18567/commits/b4d0e771656aafb77a5b1e5733e6d1ce5af081fb)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ CovBy.nhdsWithin_Ici`
`+ CovBy.nhdsWithin_Iic`
`+ DiscreteTopology.of_predOrder_succOrder`
`+ OrderTopology.of_discreteTopology`
`+ PredOrder.nhdsWithin_Iic`
`+ PredOrder.nhdsWithin_Iio`
`+ SuccOrder.nhdsWithin_Ici`
`+ SuccOrder.nhdsWithin_Ioi`
`- instance (priority := 100) DiscreteTopology.orderTopology_of_pred_succ [h : DiscreteTopology Œ±]`
`- instance (priority := 100) DiscreteTopology.orderTopology_of_pred_succ' [h : DiscreteTopology Œ±]`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/b922a972-e260-432f-a77e-bd379a68cfd8) for commit 55f103cbff0ff475cc0691a4e00cbf03950a86f9.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/1ba14f07-3206-461f-b28a-d159dce0f5c0/to/b922a972-e260-432f-a77e-bd379a68cfd8) against commit 49b4019b85a9383ac1152c0e76dda94de1e505c7.

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|+13.913‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+0.01%)|
|`Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.Basic`|+2.989‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+0.98%)|
<details><summary>2 files, Instructions +1.0‚¨ù10‚Åπ</summary>

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Measure.FiniteMeasure`|+1.893‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+2.55%)|
|`Mathlib.Topology.Order.OrderClosed`|+1.807‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+6.46%)|
</details>

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`Mathlib.Topology.Instances.Discrete`|-3.249‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(-45.31%)|
@YaelDillies Any ideas why it causes slow down? The new instance?

Yes. As I was suspecting, this new `DiscreteTopology` instance is making typeclass synthesis search through the order hierarchy because `SuccOrder` is a mixin. Do you think it can be made a non-instance? When do you want it to fire?
I have no specific plans for this instance. I'll turn it into a non-instance (at least, for now).
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/f7dca03f-7802-4c7f-a283-2c1b556bd62a) for commit b4d0e771656aafb77a5b1e5733e6d1ce5af081fb.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/c4bcf253-c972-4f09-9944-4dbbbe7560e3/to/f7dca03f-7802-4c7f-a283-2c1b556bd62a) against commit 16c9d8c2fba7254dbeb6e41eeb0554c23e5776ec.

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|-7.37‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+0.00%)|
|`Mathlib.Topology.Order.OrderClosed`|+1.814‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+5.98%)|
|`Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Measure.FiniteMeasure`|-1.826‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(-2.39%)|
|`Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.Basic`|-2.903‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(-0.94%)|
|`Mathlib.Topology.Instances.Discrete`|-3.220‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(-45.72%)|
@YaelDillies Now `!bench` says that the change makes `Mathlib` a bit faster.
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11772595942/job/32788252018)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11772595942/job/32788251729)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks! üöÄ

maintainer merge

Thanks! üöÄ

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
